results.title: America’s Most Popular Neighborhoods

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Deaths (Fatalities);Missing Persons;Vallow, Lori;Daybell, Chad;Ryan, Tylee;Vallow, Joshua;Cox, Alex;Idaho;Arizona;Hawaii
results.title: What to Know About the Trial of Lori Vallow Daybell
results.abstract: Ms. Vallow Daybell is being tried in connection with the deaths of two of her children and her husband’s previous wife. Prosecutors said she was driven by her “doomsday” religious beliefs.

media.caption: Lori Vallow Daybell has pleaded not guilty to murder, conspiracy and grand theft charges in connection with the deaths of two of her children, Tylee Ryan, 16, and Joshua Vallow, 7, who was known as J.J.

results.adx_keywords: Ethics (Personal);internal-sub-only-nl;Grandparents;Alzheimer's Disease;Elderly;Content Type: Service;Elder Care;Families and Family Life
results.title: My Grandmother Has Alzheimer’s. Do I Need to Keep Visiting Her?
results.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on the obligations we have to relatives who can no longer remember us.

results.adx_keywords: Fires and Firefighters;Agriculture and Farming;Cattle;Accidents and Safety;Livestock;South Fork Dairy Farm;Amarillo (Tex);Lubbock (Tex);Dimmitt (Tex)
results.title: About 18,000 Cattle Are Killed in Fire at Dairy Farm in Texas
results.abstract: One employee was left in “critical condition” after an explosion and blaze in Dimmitt, Texas, officials said. A thick plume of smoke mushroomed over the plains.

media.caption: A worker was rushed by helicopter to an area hospital after a fire and explosion at the South Fork Dairy Farm in Dimmitt, Texas, where about 18,000 head of cattle were lost on Monday.
media.copyright: Castro County Emergency Management, via Reuters

results.adx_keywords: Fashion and Apparel;Deaths (Obituaries);Nineteen Hundred Sixties;Quant, Mary;Alexander Plunket Greene;Great Britain;London (England)
results.title: Mary Quant, British Fashion Revolutionary, Dies at 93
results.abstract: Known as the mother of the miniskirt, clad in her signature play clothes and boots, with huge painted eyes, fake freckles and a bob, she epitomized London’s Swinging Sixties.

media.caption: Mary Quant at work in London in 1963. Her boutique in the heart of Chelsea was filled with “a bouillabaisse of clothes and accessories.”

results.adx_keywords: Football;Sexual Harassment;Stadiums and Arenas;Goodell, Roger;Snyder, Daniel M;Harris, Joshua (1965- );National Football League;Washington Commanders
results.byline: By Ken Belson and Katherine Rosman
results.title: Dan Snyder Agrees to Sell Washington Commanders for $6 Billion
results.abstract: The N.F.L. team is on track to be sold for a record figure to a group led by Josh Harris, as investigations into sexual harassment claims and the team’s finances continue.

media.caption: Dan Snyder agreed in principle to sell the Washington Commanders as the N.F.L. continued to investigate allegations of sexual harassment made against team executives and Snyder.
media.copyright: Tim Heitman/USA Today Sports, via Reuters

results.adx_keywords: Writing and Writers;Books and Literature;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Perry, Anne
results.title: Anne Perry, Crime Writer With Her Own Dark Tale, Dies at 84
results.abstract: She was well into her career as a prolific author of historical crime fiction when a murderous past was publicly revealed and dramatized in a 1994 movie.

media.caption: Anne Perry set multiple series of detective novels in 19th-century London, selling, by her count, more than 26 million copies.
media.copyright: Liz Hafalia/The San Francisco Chronicle, via Getty Images

results.title: F.B.I. Arrests National Guardsman in Leak of Classified Documents
results.abstract: Authorities say Jack Teixeira, a 21-year-old member of the Massachusetts Air National Guard, posted sensitive materials in an online chat group.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: Law enforcement personnel outside the home of Airman First Class Jack Teixeira’s mother in North Dighton, Mass., on Thursday. The F.B.I. had been zeroing in on him for several days.

results.title: Tech Consultant Arrested in San Francisco Killing of Cash App Creator
results.abstract: The police said the consultant, Nima Momeni, knew Bob Lee, who was fatally stabbed.

results.title: Fort Lauderdale Is Drenched With Up to Two Feet of Rain, Shutting Its Airport
results.abstract: Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport said flights would not resume until Friday, after water and debris covered its runways.

results.adx_keywords: Friendship;Grief (Emotion)
results.title: What to Do if a Friend Ghosts You
results.abstract: It’s not just a dating thing, and it can hurt. A lot. Here are ways to cope — and move forward.

results.adx_keywords: Sex Crimes;Assaults;Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Allen, Todd W.;Hutchinson (Kan)
results.title: Ex-Kansas Police Officer Pleads Guilty to Sexually Assaulting at Least 10 Females
results.abstract: Todd W. Allen posed as an on-duty park security officer when he approached the victims inside cars and sexually assaulted them, prosecutors said.

media.caption: Todd W. Allen, a former officer with the Hutchinson Police Department in Kansas, pleaded guilty to numerous sexual offenses on Monday in Reno County District Court.
media.copyright: Alice Mannette/Hutchinson News / USA TODAY NETWORK

results.title: Virginia Fifth Grader Is Celebrated for Spotting Textbook’s Error
results.abstract: Liam Squires, a fifth grader in Virginia, found a mistake in a book’s diagram of the rock cycle. The publisher said it was “proud” of his discovery.

results.title: ‘Harry Potter’ to Become a TV Series
results.abstract: The author J.K. Rowling is expected to be an executive producer of the show, which will appear on Max, the streaming service from Warner Bros. Discovery.

media.caption: The seven books of the “Harry Potter” series unfolded over eight films that were released between 2001 and 2011.

results.title: Should College Come With Trigger Warnings? At Cornell, It’s a ‘Hard No.’
results.abstract: When the student assembly voted to require faculty to alert students to upsetting educational materials, administrators pushed back.

media.caption: At Cornell University, the undergraduate student government wanted to require instructors to warn students about potentially traumatic course material.
media.copyright: Heather Ainsworth for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Advertising and Marketing;Labor and Jobs;internal-sub-only
results.title: Is There Life After Influencing?
results.abstract: The internet personality Lee From America wanted to see what life was like as plain old Lee Tilghman. She’s not alone. But leaving behind lucrative brand partnerships and high follower counts is harder than it looks.

media.copyright: Amy Lombard for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Elderly;Feinstein, Dianne;Khanna, Ro;Schumer, Charles E;Senate;Senate Committee on the Judiciary
results.title: Feinstein, Under Pressure to Resign, Asks to Step Down From Judiciary Panel
results.abstract: The 89-year-old California Democrat, who has been absent from the Senate for more than a month after being diagnosed with shingles, said she would seek a temporary replacement on the powerful committee.

media.caption: Senator Dianne Feinstein heading to her office on Capitol Hill in February, shortly after announcing that she would not be running for re-election in 2024.
media.copyright: Pete Marovich for The New York Times

results.title: They’re Over Being Real
results.abstract: BeReal was pitched as Gen Z’s safe haven from the artifice of social media. For some, authenticity only proved interesting for so long.

results.title: If Tennessee’s Legislature Looks Broken, It’s Not Alone
results.abstract: State legislatures around the country — plagued by partisan division, uncompetitive races and gerrymandering — reflect the current pressures on democracy.

media.caption: The Republican-controlled Tennessee House of Representatives voted on Thursday to expel Representatives Justin J. Pearson, center, and Justin Jones, behind him and to his right in a white suit. An attempt to expel a third Democratic lawmaker, Gloria Johnson, right, failed by one vote.
media.copyright: Jon Cherry for The New York Times
